LanguageData.LostAbilityToSpeak.stages.wordfinding_di: Struggling to find the right words can be frustrating and isolating. I feel embarrassed when I can't express myself clearly.
LanguageData.LostAbilityToSpeak.stages.fragmented_spe: I can speak, but my sentences are often incomplete or jumbled. It's like my thoughts are scattered, and I can't put them together.
LanguageData.LostAbilityToSpeak.stages.nonfluent.desc: Every conversation feels like a struggle. I can't form complex sentences, and it's hard to communicate even basic ideas. I want to express myself, but my words fail me.
My ability to speak has been reduced to almost nothing. I can only manage a few words at a time, and even those are difficult to pronounce. I feel trapped in my own silence.
LanguageData.LostAbilityToSpeak.stages.completely_non: I can no longer speak at all. My thoughts are locked inside me, and I can't communicate with others. I feel alone and isolated, unable to share my feelings or ideas.
LanguageData.LostMotorFunction.stages.clumsy.label: clumsy
LanguageData.LostMotorFunction.stages.clumsy.descript: My movements feel less precise than they used to be. I drop things more often and stumble occasionally. It's frustrating, but manageable.
LanguageData.LostMotorFunction.stages.shaky_and_unste: My hands tremble, and walking in a straight line takes concentration. Tasks that used to be simple now require real effort and care.
LanguageData.LostMotorFunction.stages.struggling_to_c: Basic actions are difficult. My limbs don't always respond the way I want them to, and I often lose coordination. It makes me feel helpless and vulnerable.
LanguageData.LostMotorFunction.stages.nearparalyzed.d: Moving feels like dragging weights through water. I can barely walk, and using my hands has become incredibly difficult. I rely on others for more than I'd like to admit.
LanguageData.LostMotorFunction.stages.trapped_in_a_fa: My body no longer obeys me. Every step, every grasp is a monumental challenge. I feel like a living vegetable, unable to do anything for myself, and completely dependent on others. It's a nightmare.
LanguageData.LostVisualRecognition.stages.things_look: Sometimes I catch myself hesitating, unsure of what I'm looking at. It's subtle, but unsettling - like the world is just slightly off.
LanguageData.LostVisualRecognition.stages.misrecogniz: I keep mistaking objects—or even people—for others. It's confusing, and I often feel embarrassed or disoriented.
LanguageData.LostVisualRecognition.stages.faces_blur_: Everyone looks the same. I have to rely on voices or context to tell people apart. It's isolating and makes social interaction exhausting.
LanguageData.LostVisualRecognition.stages.nothing_mak: The world around me is a jumble of shapes and colors. I can't rely on sight to recognize what I see anymore. Every task is harder, and I feel disconnected from everything.
LanguageData.ConfusedAndDisoriented.stages.disoriente: Sometimes I forget why I walked into a room or what I was just doing. It's like my thoughts vanish mid-sentence.
LanguageData.ConfusedAndDisoriented.stages.forgetting: I've started forgetting names, places, tasks. It's frustrating, like sand slipping through my fingers whenever I try to recall something.
LanguageData.ConfusedAndDisoriented.stages.losing_tra: Hours blur together. Sometimes I wake up not knowing where I am or what day it is. I feel lost - even in familiar places.
LanguageData.ConfusedAndDisoriented.stages.memories_f: Memories feel like someone else's dreams. Faces, places, and events all seem unfamiliar. I'm scared of forgetting everything.
LanguageData.ConfusedAndDisoriented.stages.losing_sen: My identity feels fragile. I struggle to remember who I am, what I've done, or what I care about. It's like I'm fading away, and I don't know how to stop it.
